meanings.definition: Able to adjust to new conditions or circumstances.
meanings.sent1: The chameleon is very adaptable, changing its color to blend in with its surroundings.
meanings.sent2: She is an adaptable student, always ready to learn new things.
meanings.sent3: The adaptable cat decided to nap in the sunniest spot in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her adaptable nature was like a chameleon, seamlessly fitting into any situation.
meanings.sent5: The adaptable tree branches swayed gracefully in the wind.

meanings.definition: Capable of being modified for a different purpose.
meanings.sent1: The adaptable software can be customized to suit various needs.
meanings.sent2: The toy blocks are adaptable, allowing children to build different structures.
meanings.sent3: He found an adaptable use for the old shoebox, turning it into a makeshift storage container.
meanings.sent4: Her adaptable wardrobe consisted of pieces that could be mixed and matched for any occasion.
meanings.sent5: The adaptable tool could be adjusted to fit different sizes of screws.

meanings.sent1: Being adaptable in negotiations can lead to successful agreements for both parties.
meanings.sent2: She is an adaptable team player, always open to new ideas.
meanings.sent3: The adaptable siblings took turns choosing the movie they would watch.
meanings.sent4: His adaptable attitude made him a valuable member of the group project.
meanings.sent5: The adaptable schedule allowed for changes to be made easily.
